Key Match Events: Chicago Cubs snapped an 18-inning scoreless skid to salvage the series from the New York Yankees with a 2-1 win
Others: Isaac Paredes snapped an 0-for-14 skid with the hit
The Cubs (73-70) dropped two of three to the Yankees and entered the day with a 0.7% chance to make it to the playoffs, according to FanGraphs
The Cubs pitchers held the Yankees to six runs
The Cubs offense was shut out for 18 innings on five hits and hit.087 in that span
The Cubs visit the National League West-leading Los Angeles Dodgers for a three-game set starting Monday
